definition: Al-Mansur/Abu Jafar al Mansur (712-775), second Abassid caliph
surname Su/abbr. for Soviet Union 蘇維埃|苏维埃 or 蘇聯|苏联/abbr. for Jiangsu province 江蘇|江苏/abbr. for Suzhou city 蘇州|苏州
Perilla frutescens (Chinese basil or wild red basil)/place name/to revive/used as phonetic in transliteration

sentences.english: Mansur was probably the name of John's father.
sentences.chinese: 曼苏尔大概是名字的约翰的父亲。

sentences.english: Mr. Mansoor has been criticized for the movie's depiction of religious intolerance.
sentences.chinese: 有人批评曼苏尔，说这部电影描述了伊斯兰教的偏执。

definition: Nasr or Nasser (Arab name)/Gamal Abdel Nasser (1918-1970), Egyptian President
Suleiman (name)/General Michel Suleiman (1948-), Lebanese military man and politician, president of Lebanon 2008-2014
(loanword) caliph/also written 哈利發|哈利发[ha1 li4 fa1]
Mohammed (c. 570-632), central figure of Islam and prophet of God
Husain or Hussein (name)/Hussein (c. 626-680), Muslim leader whose martyrdom is commemorated at Ashura/Saddam Hussein al Tikriti (1937-2006), dictator of Iraq 1979-2003
Hosni Mubarak (1928-), former Egyptian President and military commander
Bashir (name)/Omar Hassan Ahmad al-Bashir (1944-), Sudanese military man and politician, president of Sudan from 1993
Sudan/sultan (ruler of some Muslim states, esp. Ottoman Emperor)
Abbasid Empire (750-1258), successor of the Umayyad caliphate
